member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddAttachmentsToSetRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AddAttachmentsToSet operation. Adds one or more attachments to an attachment set.
An attachment set is a temporary container for attachments that you add to a case or case communication. The set is available for 1 hour after it's created. The expiryTime returned in the response is when the set expires.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddAttachmentsToSetRequest.Attachments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attachments.
One or more attachments to add to the set. You can add up to three attachments per set. The size limit is 5 MB per attachment.
In the Attachment object, use the data parameter to specify the contents of the attachment file. In the previous request syntax, the value for data appear as blob, which is represented as a base64-encoded string. The value for fileName is the name of the attachment, such as troubleshoot-screenshot.png.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddAttachmentsToSetRequest.AttachmentSetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttachmentSetId.
The ID of the attachment set. If an attachmentSetId is not specified, a new attachment set is created, and the ID of the set is returned in the response. If an attachmentSetId is specified, the attachments are added to the specified set, if it exists.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddAttachmentsToSetResponse
member.summary: The ID and expiry time of the attachment set returned by the AddAttachmentsToSet operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddAttachmentsToSetResponse.AttachmentSetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttachmentSetId.
The ID of the attachment set. If an attachmentSetId was not specified, a new attachment set is created, and the ID of the set is returned in the response. If an attachmentSetId was specified, the attachments are added to the specified set, if it exists.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddAttachmentsToSetResponse.ExpiryTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpiryTime.
The time and date when the attachment set expires.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddCommunicationToCaseRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AddCommunicationToCase operation. Adds additional customer communication to an AWS Support case. Use the caseId parameter to identify the case to which to add communication. You can list a set of email addresses to copy on the communication by using the ccEmailAddresses parameter. The communicationBody value contains the text of the communication.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddCommunicationToCaseRequest.AttachmentSetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttachmentSetId.
The ID of a set of one or more attachments for the communication to add to the case. Create the set by calling AddAttachmentsToSet

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddCommunicationToCaseRequest.CaseId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CaseId.
The support case ID requested or returned in the call. The case ID is an alphanumeric string formatted as shown in this example: case-12345678910-2013-c4c1d2bf33c5cf47

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddCommunicationToCaseRequest.CcEmailAddresses
member.summary:

The email addresses in the CC line of an email to be added to the support case.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CaseDetails
member.summary:
A JSON-formatted object that contains the metadata for a support case. It is contained in the response from a DescribeCases request. CaseDetails contains the following fields:
caseId - The support case ID requested or returned in the call. The case ID is an alphanumeric string formatted as shown in this example: case-12345678910-2013-c4c1d2bf33c5cf47.
categoryCode - The category of problem for the support case. Corresponds to the CategoryCode values returned by a call to DescribeServices.
displayId - The identifier for the case on pages in the AWS Support Center.
language - The ISO 639-1 code for the language in which AWS provides support. AWS Support currently supports English ("en") and Japanese ("ja"). Language parameters must be passed explicitly for operations that take them.
nextToken - A resumption point for pagination.
recentCommunications - One or more Communication objects. Fields of these objects are attachments, body, caseId, submittedBy, and timeCreated.
serviceCode - The identifier for the AWS service that corresponds to the service code defined in the call to DescribeServices.
severityCode - The severity code assigned to the case. Contains one of the values returned by the call to DescribeSeverityLevels. The possible values are: low, normal, high, urgent, and critical.
status - The status of the case in the AWS Support Center. Valid values:
opened
pending-customer-action
reopened
resolved
unassigned
work-in-progress
subject - The subject line of the case.
submittedBy - The email address of the account that submitted the case.
timeCreated - The time the case was created, in ISO-8601 format.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CaseDetails.CaseId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CaseId.
The support case ID requested or returned in the call. The case ID is an alphanumeric string formatted as shown in this example: case-12345678910-2013-c4c1d2bf33c5cf47

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CaseDetails.CategoryCode
member.summary:

The email addresses that receive copies of communication about the case.

The ID displayed for the case in the AWS Support Center. This is a numeric string.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CaseDetails.Language
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Language.
The ISO 639-1 code for the language in which AWS provides support. AWS Support currently supports English ("en") and Japanese ("ja"). Language parameters must be passed explicitly for operations that take them.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CaseDetails.RecentCommunications
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecentCommunications.
The five most recent communications between you and AWS Support Center, including the IDs of any attachments to the communications. Also includes a nextToken that you can use to retrieve earlier communications.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CaseDetails.ServiceCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceCode.
The code for the AWS service. You can get a list of codes and the corresponding service names by calling DescribeServices.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CaseDetails.SeverityCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SeverityCode.
The code for the severity level returned by the call to DescribeSeverityLevels.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the case.
Valid values:
opened

reopened
resolved
unassigned
work-in-progress

The subject line for the case in the AWS Support Center.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CaseDetails.SubmittedBy

The email address of the account that submitted the case.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateCase operation. Creates a case in the AWS Support Center. This operation is similar to how you create a case in the AWS Support Center Create Case page.
The AWS Support API doesn't support requesting service limit increases. You can submit a service limit increase in the following ways:
Submit a request from the AWS Support Center Create Case page.
Use the Service Quotas RequestServiceQuotaIncrease operation.
A successful CreateCase request returns an AWS Support case number. You can use the DescribeCases operation and specify the case number to get existing AWS Support cases. After you create a case, use the AddCommunicationToCase operation to add additional communication or attachments to an existing case.
The caseId is separate from the displayId that appears in the AWS Support Center. Use the DescribeCases operation to get the displayId.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest.AttachmentSetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttachmentSetId.
The ID of a set of one or more attachments for the case. Create the set by using the AddAttachmentsToSet operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest.CategoryCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CategoryCode.
The category of problem for the support case. You also use the DescribeServices operation to get the category code for a service. Each AWS service defines its own set of category codes.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest.CcEmailAddresses
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CcEmailAddresses.
A list of email addresses that AWS Support copies on case correspondence. AWS Support identifies the account that creates the case when you specify your AWS credentials in an HTTP POST method or use the AWS SDKs.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest.CommunicationBody
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CommunicationBody.
The communication body text that describes the issue. This text appears in the Description field on the AWS Support Center Create Case page.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest.IssueType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IssueType.
The type of issue for the case. You can specify customer-service or technical. If you don't specify a value, the default is technical.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest.Language
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Language.
The language in which AWS Support handles the case. You must specify the ISO 639-1 code for the language parameter if you want support in that language. Currently, English ("en") and Japanese ("ja") are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest.ServiceCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceCode.
The code for the AWS service. You can use the DescribeServices operation to get the possible serviceCode values.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest.SeverityCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SeverityCode.
A value that indicates the urgency of the case. This value determines the response time according to your service level agreement with AWS Support. You can use the DescribeSeverityLevels operation to get the possible values for severityCode.
For more information, see SeverityLevel and Choosing a Severity in the AWS Support User Guide.
The availability of severity levels depends on the support plan for the AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest.Subject
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subject.
The title of the support case. The title appears in the Subject field on the AWS Support Center Create Case page.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseResponse
member.summary: The support case ID returned by a successful completion of the CreateCase operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseResponse.CaseId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CaseId.
The support case ID requested or returned in the call. The case ID is an alphanumeric string in the following format: case-12345678910-2013-c4c1d2bf33c5cf47

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeAttachmentRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeAttachment operation. Returns the attachment that has the specified ID. Attachments can include screenshots, error logs, or other files that describe your issue. Attachment IDs are generated by the case management system when you add an attachment to a case or case communication. Attachment IDs are returned in the AttachmentDetails objects that are returned by the DescribeCommunications operation.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeAttachmentRequest.AttachmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttachmentId.
The ID of the attachment to return. Attachment IDs are returned by the DescribeCommunications operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeAttachmentResponse
member.summary: The content and file name of the attachment returned by the DescribeAttachment operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeAttachmentResponse.Attachment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attachment.
This object includes the attachment content and file name.
In the previous response syntax, the value for the data parameter appears as blob, which is represented as a base64-encoded string. The value for fileName is the name of the attachment, such as troubleshoot-screenshot.png.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCasesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeCases operation. Returns a list of cases that you specify by passing one or more case IDs. You can use the afterTime and beforeTime parameters to filter the cases by date. You can set values for the includeResolvedCases and includeCommunications parameters to specify how much information to return.
The response returns the following in JSON format:
One or more CaseDetails data types.
One or more nextToken values, which specify where to paginate the returned records represented by the CaseDetails objects.
Case data is available for 12 months after creation. If a case was created more than 12 months ago, a request might return an error.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCasesRequest.AfterTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AfterTime.
The start date for a filtered date search on support case communications. Case communications are available for 12 months after creation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCasesRequest.BeforeTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BeforeTime.
The end date for a filtered date search on support case communications. Case communications are available for 12 months after creation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCasesRequest.CaseIdList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CaseIdList.
A list of ID numbers of the support cases you want returned. The maximum number of cases is 100.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCasesRequest.DisplayId
member.summary:

Specifies whether to include communications in the DescribeCases response. By default, communications are included.

Specifies whether to include resolved support cases in the DescribeCases response. By default, resolved cases aren't included.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCommunicationsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeCommunications operation. Returns communications and attachments for one or more support cases. Use the afterTime and beforeTime parameters to filter by date. You can use the caseId parameter to restrict the results to a specific case.
Case data is available for 12 months after creation. If a case was created more than 12 months ago, a request for data might cause an error.
You can use the maxResults and nextToken parameters to control the pagination of the results. Set maxResults to the number of cases that you want to display on each page, and use nextToken to specify the resumption of pagination.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BeforeTime.
The end date for a filtered date search on support case communications. Case communications are available for 12 months after creation.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeServicesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeServices operation. Returns the current list of AWS services and a list of service categories for each service. You then use service names and categories in your CreateCase requests. Each AWS service has its own set of categories.
The service codes and category codes correspond to the values that appear in the Service and Category lists on the AWS Support Center Create Case page. The values in those fields don't necessarily match the service codes and categories returned by the DescribeServices operation. Always use the service codes and categories that the DescribeServices operation returns, so that you have the most recent set of service and category codes.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeServicesRequest.Language
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Language.
The ISO 639-1 code for the language in which AWS provides support. AWS Support currently supports English ("en") and Japanese ("ja"). Language parameters must be passed explicitly for operations that take them.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeServicesRequest.ServiceCodeList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceCodeList.
A JSON-formatted list of service codes available for AWS services.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeSeverityLevelsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeSeverityLevels operation. Returns the list of severity levels that you can assign to a support case. The severity level for a case is also a field in the CaseDetails data type that you include for a CreateCase request.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

The ISO 639-1 code for the language in which AWS provides support. AWS Support currently supports English ("en") and Japanese ("ja"). Language parameters must be passed explicitly for operations that take them.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SeverityLevels.
The available severity levels for the support case. Available severity levels are defined by your service level agreement with AWS.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatusesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatuses operation. Returns the refresh status of the AWS Trusted Advisor checks that have the specified check IDs. You can get the check IDs by calling the DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks operation.
Some checks are refreshed automatically, and you can't return their refresh statuses by using the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatuses operation. If you call this operation for these checks, you might see an InvalidParameterValue error.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatusesRequest.CheckIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CheckIds.
The IDs of the Trusted Advisor checks to get the status.
If you specify the check ID of a check that is automatically refreshed, you might see an InvalidParameterValue error.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatusesResponse
member.summary: The statuses of the Trusted Advisor checks returned by the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatuses operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatusesResponse.Statuses
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Statuses.
The refresh status of the specified Trusted Advisor checks.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResultRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult operation. Returns the results of the AWS Trusted Advisor check that has the specified check ID. You can get the check IDs by calling the DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks operation.
The response contains a TrustedAdvisorCheckResult object, which contains these three objects:
TrustedAdvisorCategorySpecificSummary
TrustedAdvisorResourceDetail
TrustedAdvisorResourcesSummary
In addition, the response contains these fields:
status - The alert status of the check can be ok (green), warning (yellow), error (red), or not_available.
timestamp - The time of the last refresh of the check.
checkId - The unique identifier for the check.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResultRequest.CheckId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CheckId.
The unique identifier for the Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResultRequest.Language
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Language.
The ISO 639-1 code for the language in which AWS provides support. AWS Support currently supports English ("en") and Japanese ("ja"). Language parameters must be passed explicitly for operations that take them.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResultResponse
member.summary: The result of the Trusted Advisor check returned by the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResultResponse.Result
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Result.
The detailed results of the Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecksRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks operation. Returns information about all available AWS Trusted Advisor checks, including the name, ID, category, description, and metadata. You must specify a language code. The AWS Support API currently supports English ("en") and Japanese ("ja"). The response contains a TrustedAdvisorCheckDescription object for each check. You must set the AWS Region to us-east-1.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
The names and descriptions for Trusted Advisor checks are subject to change. We recommend that you specify the check ID in your code to uniquely identify a check.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Language.
The ISO 639-1 code for the language in which AWS provides support. AWS Support currently supports English ("en") and Japanese ("ja"). Language parameters must be passed explicitly for operations that take them.

Container for the parameters to the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckSummaries operation. Returns the results for the AWS Trusted Advisor check summaries for the check IDs that you specified. You can get the check IDs by calling the DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks operation.
The response contains an array of TrustedAdvisorCheckSummary objects.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.RefreshTrustedAdvisorCheckRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the RefreshTrustedAdvisorCheck operation. Refreshes the AWS Trusted Advisor check that you specify using the check ID. You can get the check IDs by calling the DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks operation.
Some checks are refreshed automatically. If you call the RefreshTrustedAdvisorCheck operation to refresh them, you might see the InvalidParameterValue error.
The response contains a TrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatus object.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.RefreshTrustedAdvisorCheckRequest.CheckId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CheckId.
The unique identifier for the Trusted Advisor check to refresh.
Specifying the check ID of a check that is automatically refreshed causes an InvalidParameterValue error.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.RefreshTrustedAdvisorCheckResponse
member.summary: The current refresh status of a Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.RefreshTrustedAdvisorCheckResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current refresh status for a check, including the amount of time until the check is eligible for refresh.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.ResolveCaseRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ResolveCase operation. Resolves a support case. This operation takes a caseId and returns the initial and final state of the case.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.ResolveCaseRequest.CaseId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CaseId.
The support case ID requested or returned in the call. The case ID is an alphanumeric string formatted as shown in this example: case-12345678910-2013-c4c1d2bf33c5cf47

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.ResolveCaseResponse
member.summary: The status of the case returned by the ResolveCase operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.ResolveCaseResponse.FinalCaseStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FinalCaseStatus.
The status of the case after the ResolveCase request was processed.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.ResolveCaseResponse.InitialCaseStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InitialCaseStatus.
The status of the case when the ResolveCase request was sent.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.Service
member.summary: Information about an AWS service returned by the DescribeServices operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.Service.Categories
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Categories.
A list of categories that describe the type of support issue a case describes. Categories consist of a category name and a category code. Category names and codes are passed to AWS Support when you call CreateCase.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.Service.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
The code for an AWS service returned by the DescribeServices response. The name element contains the corresponding friendly name.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.Service.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The friendly name for an AWS service. The code element contains the corresponding code.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.SeverityLevel
member.summary: A code and name pair that represents the severity level of a support case. The available values depend on the support plan for the account. For more information, see Choosing a severity in the AWS Support User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.SeverityLevel.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
The code for case severity level.
Valid values: low | normal | high | urgent | critical

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.SeverityLevel.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the severity level that corresponds to the severity level code.
The values returned by the API are different from the values that appear in the AWS Support Center. For example, the API uses the code low, but the name appears as General guidance in Support Center.
The following are the API code names and how they appear in the console:
low - General guidance
normal - System impaired
high - Production system impaired
urgent - Production system down
critical - Business-critical system down
For more information, see Choosing a severity in the AWS Support User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCategorySpecificSummary
member.summary: The container for summary information that relates to the category of the Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCategorySpecificSummary.CostOptimizing
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CostOptimizing.
The summary information about cost savings for a Trusted Advisor check that is in the Cost Optimizing category.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckDescription
member.summary: The description and metadata for a Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckDescription.Category
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Category.
The category of the Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckDescription.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the Trusted Advisor check, which includes the alert criteria and recommended operations (contains HTML markup).

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckDescription.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckDescription.Metadata
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metadata.
The column headings for the data returned by the Trusted Advisor check. The order of the headings corresponds to the order of the data in the Metadata element of the TrustedAdvisorResourceDetail for the check. Metadata contains all the data that is shown in the Excel download, even in those cases where the UI shows just summary data.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckDescription.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The display name for the Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatus
member.summary: The refresh status of a Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatus.CheckId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CheckId.
The unique identifier for the Trusted Advisor check.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatus.MillisUntilNextRefreshable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MillisUntilNextRefreshable.
The amount of time, in milliseconds, until the Trusted Advisor check is eligible for refresh.

member.name: P:Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.TrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatus.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the Trusted Advisor check for which a refresh has been requested:
none - The check is not refreshed or the non-success status exceeds the timeout
enqueued - The check refresh requests has entered the refresh queue
processing - The check refresh request is picked up by the rule processing engine
success - The check is successfully refreshed
abandoned - The check refresh has failed

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing AWSSupport
AWS Support
The AWS Support API Reference is intended for programmers who need detailed information about the AWS Support operations and data types. You can use the API to manage your support cases programmatically. The AWS Support API uses HTTP methods that return results in JSON format.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
The AWS Support service also exposes a set of AWS Trusted Advisor features. You can retrieve a list of checks and their descriptions, get check results, specify checks to refresh, and get the refresh status of checks.
The following list describes the AWS Support case management operations:
Service names, issue categories, and available severity levels - The DescribeServices and DescribeSeverityLevels operations return AWS service names, service codes, service categories, and problem severity levels. You use these values when you call the CreateCase operation.
Case creation, case details, and case resolution - The CreateCase, DescribeCases, DescribeAttachment, and ResolveCase operations create AWS Support cases, retrieve information about cases, and resolve cases.
Case communication - The DescribeCommunications, AddCommunicationToCase, and AddAttachmentsToSet operations retrieve and add communications and attachments to AWS Support cases.
The following list describes the operations available from the AWS Support service for Trusted Advisor:
DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks returns the list of checks that run against your AWS resources.
Using the checkId for a specific check returned by DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks, you can call DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult to obtain the results for the check that you specified.
DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckSummaries returns summarized results for one or more Trusted Advisor checks.
RefreshTrustedAdvisorCheck requests that Trusted Advisor rerun a specified check.
DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatuses reports the refresh status of one or more checks.
For authentication of requests, AWS Support uses Signature Version 4 Signing Process.
See About the AWS Support API in the AWS Support User Guide for information about how to use this service to create and manage your support cases, and how to call Trusted Advisor for results of checks on your resources.

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAWSSupportClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.AddAttachmentsToSet(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddAttachmentsToSetRequest)
member.summary:
Adds one or more attachments to an attachment set.
An attachment set is a temporary container for attachments that you add to a case or case communication. The set is available for 1 hour after it's created. The expiryTime returned in the response is when the set expires.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AddAttachmentsToSet service method.
member.returns: The response from the AddAttachmentsToSet service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: The limit for the number of attachment sets created in a short period of time has been exceeded.
The expiration time of the attachment set has passed. The set expires 1 hour after it is created.
An attachment set with the specified ID could not be found.
A limit for the size of an attachment set has been exceeded. The limits are three attachments and 5 MB per attachment.
An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for AddAttachmentsToSet Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.AddCommunicationToCase(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddCommunicationToCaseRequest)
member.summary:
Adds additional customer communication to an AWS Support case. Use the caseId parameter to identify the case to which to add communication. You can list a set of email addresses to copy on the communication by using the ccEmailAddresses parameter. The communicationBody value contains the text of the communication.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

An internal server error occurred.

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.CreateCase(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a case in the AWS Support Center. This operation is similar to how you create a case in the AWS Support Center Create Case page.
The AWS Support API doesn't support requesting service limit increases. You can submit a service limit increase in the following ways:
Submit a request from the AWS Support Center Create Case page.
Use the Service Quotas RequestServiceQuotaIncrease operation.
A successful CreateCase request returns an AWS Support case number. You can use the DescribeCases operation and specify the case number to get existing AWS Support cases. After you create a case, use the AddCommunicationToCase operation to add additional communication or attachments to an existing case.
The caseId is separate from the displayId that appears in the AWS Support Center. Use the DescribeCases operation to get the displayId.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateCase service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateCase service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: The expiration time of the attachment set has passed. The set expires 1 hour after it is created.
An attachment set with the specified ID could not be found.
The case creation limit for the account has been exceeded.
An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateCase Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.DescribeAttachment(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeAttachmentRequest)
member.summary:
Returns the attachment that has the specified ID. Attachments can include screenshots, error logs, or other files that describe your issue. Attachment IDs are generated by the case management system when you add an attachment to a case or case communication. Attachment IDs are returned in the AttachmentDetails objects that are returned by the DescribeCommunications operation.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeAttachment service method.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeAttachment service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: An attachment with the specified ID could not be found.
The limit for the number of DescribeAttachment requests in a short period of time has been exceeded.
An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeAttachment Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.DescribeCases(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCasesRequest)
member.summary:
Returns a list of cases that you specify by passing one or more case IDs. You can use the afterTime and beforeTime parameters to filter the cases by date. You can set values for the includeResolvedCases and includeCommunications parameters to specify how much information to return.
The response returns the following in JSON format:
One or more CaseDetails data types.
One or more nextToken values, which specify where to paginate the returned records represented by the CaseDetails objects.
Case data is available for 12 months after creation. If a case was created more than 12 months ago, a request might return an error.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeCases service method.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeCases service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: The requested caseId couldn't be located.
An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeCases Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.DescribeCommunications(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCommunicationsRequest)
member.summary:
Returns communications and attachments for one or more support cases. Use the afterTime and beforeTime parameters to filter by date. You can use the caseId parameter to restrict the results to a specific case.
Case data is available for 12 months after creation. If a case was created more than 12 months ago, a request for data might cause an error.
You can use the maxResults and nextToken parameters to control the pagination of the results. Set maxResults to the number of cases that you want to display on each page, and use nextToken to specify the resumption of pagination.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

An internal server error occurred.

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.DescribeServices
member.summary:
Returns the current list of AWS services and a list of service categories for each service. You then use service names and categories in your CreateCase requests. Each AWS service has its own set of categories.
The service codes and category codes correspond to the values that appear in the Service and Category lists on the AWS Support Center Create Case page. The values in those fields don't necessarily match the service codes and categories returned by the DescribeServices operation. Always use the service codes and categories that the DescribeServices operation returns, so that you have the most recent set of service and category codes.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeServices service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeServices Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatuses(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatusesRequest)
member.summary:

Some checks are refreshed automatically, and you can't return their refresh statuses by using the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatuses operation. If you call this operation for these checks, you might see an InvalidParameterValue error.

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResultRequest)
member.summary:
Returns the results of the AWS Trusted Advisor check that has the specified check ID. You can get the check IDs by calling the DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks operation.
The response contains a TrustedAdvisorCheckResult object, which contains these three objects:
TrustedAdvisorCategorySpecificSummary
TrustedAdvisorResourceDetail
TrustedAdvisorResourcesSummary
In addition, the response contains these fields:
status - The alert status of the check can be ok (green), warning (yellow), error (red), or not_available.
timestamp - The time of the last refresh of the check.
checkId - The unique identifier for the check.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult service method.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.AmazonAWSSupportClient.DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecksRequest)
member.summary:
Returns information about all available AWS Trusted Advisor checks, including the name, ID, category, description, and metadata. You must specify a language code. The AWS Support API currently supports English ("en") and Japanese ("ja"). The response contains a TrustedAdvisorCheckDescription object for each check. You must set the AWS Region to us-east-1.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
The names and descriptions for Trusted Advisor checks are subject to change. We recommend that you specify the check ID in your code to uniquely identify a check.

member.exception: An internal server error occurred.

member.name: T:Amazon.AWSSupport.IAmazonAWSSupport
member.summary:
Interface for accessing AWSSupport
AWS Support
The AWS Support API Reference is intended for programmers who need detailed information about the AWS Support operations and data types. You can use the API to manage your support cases programmatically. The AWS Support API uses HTTP methods that return results in JSON format.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
The AWS Support service also exposes a set of AWS Trusted Advisor features. You can retrieve a list of checks and their descriptions, get check results, specify checks to refresh, and get the refresh status of checks.
The following list describes the AWS Support case management operations:
Service names, issue categories, and available severity levels - The DescribeServices and DescribeSeverityLevels operations return AWS service names, service codes, service categories, and problem severity levels. You use these values when you call the CreateCase operation.
Case creation, case details, and case resolution - The CreateCase, DescribeCases, DescribeAttachment, and ResolveCase operations create AWS Support cases, retrieve information about cases, and resolve cases.
Case communication - The DescribeCommunications, AddCommunicationToCase, and AddAttachmentsToSet operations retrieve and add communications and attachments to AWS Support cases.
The following list describes the operations available from the AWS Support service for Trusted Advisor:
DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks returns the list of checks that run against your AWS resources.
Using the checkId for a specific check returned by DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks, you can call DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult to obtain the results for the check that you specified.
DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckSummaries returns summarized results for one or more Trusted Advisor checks.
RefreshTrustedAdvisorCheck requests that Trusted Advisor rerun a specified check.
DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatuses reports the refresh status of one or more checks.
For authentication of requests, AWS Support uses Signature Version 4 Signing Process.
See About the AWS Support API in the AWS Support User Guide for information about how to use this service to create and manage your support cases, and how to call Trusted Advisor for results of checks on your resources.

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.IAmazonAWSSupport.AddAttachmentsToSet(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.AddAttachmentsToSetRequest)
member.summary:
Adds one or more attachments to an attachment set.
An attachment set is a temporary container for attachments that you add to a case or case communication. The set is available for 1 hour after it's created. The expiryTime returned in the response is when the set expires.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AddAttachmentsToSet service method.
member.returns: The response from the AddAttachmentsToSet service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: The limit for the number of attachment sets created in a short period of time has been exceeded.
The expiration time of the attachment set has passed. The set expires 1 hour after it is created.
An attachment set with the specified ID could not be found.
A limit for the size of an attachment set has been exceeded. The limits are three attachments and 5 MB per attachment.
An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for AddAttachmentsToSet Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.IAmazonAWSSupport.CreateCase(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.CreateCaseRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a case in the AWS Support Center. This operation is similar to how you create a case in the AWS Support Center Create Case page.
The AWS Support API doesn't support requesting service limit increases. You can submit a service limit increase in the following ways:
Submit a request from the AWS Support Center Create Case page.
Use the Service Quotas RequestServiceQuotaIncrease operation.
A successful CreateCase request returns an AWS Support case number. You can use the DescribeCases operation and specify the case number to get existing AWS Support cases. After you create a case, use the AddCommunicationToCase operation to add additional communication or attachments to an existing case.
The caseId is separate from the displayId that appears in the AWS Support Center. Use the DescribeCases operation to get the displayId.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateCase service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateCase service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: The expiration time of the attachment set has passed. The set expires 1 hour after it is created.
An attachment set with the specified ID could not be found.
The case creation limit for the account has been exceeded.
An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateCase Operation

Attachment IDs are generated by the case management system when you add an attachment to a case or case communication. member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.IAmazonAWSSupport.DescribeCases(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCasesRequest)
member.summary:
Returns a list of cases that you specify by passing one or more case IDs. You can use the afterTime and beforeTime parameters to filter the cases by date. You can set values for the includeResolvedCases and includeCommunications parameters to specify how much information to return.
The response returns the following in JSON format:
One or more CaseDetails data types.
One or more nextToken values, which specify where to paginate the returned records represented by the CaseDetails objects.
Case data is available for 12 months after creation. If a case was created more than 12 months ago, a request might return an error.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeCases service method.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeCases service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: The requested caseId couldn't be located.
An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeCases Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.IAmazonAWSSupport.DescribeCommunications(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeCommunicationsRequest)
member.summary:
Returns communications and attachments for one or more support cases. Use the afterTime and beforeTime parameters to filter by date. You can use the caseId parameter to restrict the results to a specific case.
Case data is available for 12 months after creation. If a case was created more than 12 months ago, a request for data might cause an error.
You can use the maxResults and nextToken parameters to control the pagination of the results. Set maxResults to the number of cases that you want to display on each page, and use nextToken to specify the resumption of pagination.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.IAmazonAWSSupport.DescribeServices
member.summary:
Returns the current list of AWS services and a list of service categories for each service. You then use service names and categories in your CreateCase requests. Each AWS service has its own set of categories.
The service codes and category codes correspond to the values that appear in the Service and Category lists on the AWS Support Center Create Case page. The values in those fields don't necessarily match the service codes and categories returned by the DescribeServices operation. Always use the service codes and categories that the DescribeServices operation returns, so that you have the most recent set of service and category codes.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeServices service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeServices Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.IAmazonAWSSupport.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatuses(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatusesRequest)
member.summary:
Returns the refresh status of the AWS Trusted Advisor checks that have the specified check IDs. You can get the check IDs by calling the DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks operation.
Some checks are refreshed automatically, and you can't return their refresh statuses by using the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckRefreshStatuses operation. If you call this operation for these checks, you might see an InvalidParameterValue error.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.IAmazonAWSSupport.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResultRequest)
member.summary:
Returns the results of the AWS Trusted Advisor check that has the specified check ID. You can get the check IDs by calling the DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks operation.
The response contains a TrustedAdvisorCheckResult object, which contains these three objects:
TrustedAdvisorCategorySpecificSummary
TrustedAdvisorResourceDetail
TrustedAdvisorResourcesSummary
In addition, the response contains these fields:
status - The alert status of the check can be ok (green), warning (yellow), error (red), or not_available.
timestamp - The time of the last refresh of the check.
checkId - The unique identifier for the check.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult service method.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: An internal server error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeTrustedAdvisorCheckResult Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AWSSupport.IAmazonAWSSupport.DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks(Amazon.AWSSupport.Model.DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecksRequest)
member.summary:
Returns information about all available AWS Trusted Advisor checks, including the name, ID, category, description, and metadata. You must specify a language code. The AWS Support API currently supports English ("en") and Japanese ("ja"). The response contains a TrustedAdvisorCheckDescription object for each check. You must set the AWS Region to us-east-1.
You must have a Business or Enterprise Support plan to use the AWS Support API.
If you call the AWS Support API from an account that does not have a Business or Enterprise Support plan, the SubscriptionRequiredException error message appears. For information about changing your support plan, see AWS Support.
The names and descriptions for Trusted Advisor checks are subject to change. We recommend that you specify the check ID in your code to uniquely identify a check.

member.returns: The response from the DescribeTrustedAdvisorChecks service method, as returned by AWSSupport.
member.exception: An internal server error occurred.
